JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant , an engineer with a university degree , applied for the post of building inspector in the municipality of Tuusula . On DATE a Mr J. , a building engineer , was appointed .
On DATE the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by ORG ( ympäristö- ja rakennuslautakunta , miljö- och byggnadsnämnden ) on DATE .

On DATE the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG ( hallinto - oikeus , förvaltningsdomstolen ) overturned the decision , finding that the appointment procedure had been flawed by the fact that the applicant had not been among those candidates invited to an interview .
On DATE the municipality appealed . On DATE the applicant replied to the appeal . The municipality filed a second set of representations .

On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) overturned the lower court ’s decision . It held that the fact that , of the twenty persons who had applied for the post , CARDINAL had been interviewed did not disclose any partiality in the preparation of the case . Nor did it find that there were such differences between the applicant and Mr J. that ORG could be considered to have gone beyond its margin of appreciation when appointing the latter to the post . It had not transpired that the decision not to appoint the applicant could have been based on his age , as alleged by the applicant .
The applicant applied for the post of building inspector in the municipality of ORG . On DATE PERSON , a building engineer , was appointed .
On DATE the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by ORG ( ympäristölautakunta , miljönämnden ) on DATE .

On DATE the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , finding that there were no such differences between the applicant and PERSON that ORG could be considered to have gone beyond its margin of appreciation when appointing the latter to the post .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .

The applicant applied for the post of building inspector / master builder in the municipality of PERSON . On DATE a Mr H. , an engineer with a university degree , was appointed by ORG ( kunnanhallitus , kommunalstyrelsen ) .
On DATE the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by ORG on DATE .
On DATE the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of building inspector in the municipality of Sahalahti . On DATE a PERSON , an engineer , was appointed by ORG ( kunnanvaltuusto , kommunalfullmäktige ) .
On DATE the applicant appealed . On CARDINAL DATE ORG overturned the decision insofar as PERSON a PERSON had been given priority over the applicant in the event that PERSON did not accept the post .
On an unspecified date the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of deputy to the building inspector in the municipality of ORG . On DATE a Ms U. , a master builder , was appointed .
On DATE the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by ORG on DATE .
On DATE the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of building inspector in the municipality of ORG . On DATE PERSON , a building engineer , was appointed by ORG .
On an unspecified date the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by ORG on DATE .
On an unspecified date the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of building inspector in the municipality of GPE . On DATE a Mr L. , an engineer , was appointed by ORG .
On an unspecified date the applicant applied for rectification , which was rejected by the municipal executive board on DATE .
On an unspecified date the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of city engineer in the municipality of ORG . On DATE a Mr V. , a building engineer , was appointed by ORG .
On an unspecified date the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
On DATE the applicant appealed further . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal , endorsing the lower court ’s reasons .
The applicant applied for the post of technical director in the municipality of PERSON . On DATE a Mr R. , an engineer with a university degree , was appointed by ORG .

On an unspecified date the applicant appealed . On DATE ORG overturned the decision , finding that the appointment procedure had been flawed by the fact that the applicant had not been among those candidates invited to an interview .

On unspecified dates PERSON and the municipality appealed . On DATE ORG overturned the lower court ’s decision . It held that the fact that , of the CARDINAL persons who had applied for the post , CARDINAL had been interviewed did not disclose any partiality in the preparation of the case . Nor did it find that there were such differences between the applicant and PERSON that the municipal board could be considered to have gone beyond its margin of appreciation when appointing the latter to the post . It had not transpired that the decision not to appoint the applicant could have been based on his age , as alleged .
